# Erasure coding

Attempt to achieve encoding alignment with davxy and javajam EC vectors

* [test_davxy](https://github.com/davxy/jam-test-vectors/tree/erasure_coding) -- specifically test_segment_shards_tiny.json
* [test_javajam](https://github.com/javajamio/javajam-trace/tree/main/erasure_coding) -- specifically segment_tiny.json

Status:
* neither encoding process results in the recovery shards

Probably there is a conceptual model, a package config difference, between 3 of us.  

Because the RS package has a requirement to use 64-byte alignment (see [here](https://github.com/ordian/reed-solomon-simd?tab=readme-ov-file#simple-usage))

* 4104 bytes has to be split into 2 shards of 2052 as the "original"
* but 2052 has to be "rounded up" to 2112 to use the package, and generate 4 additional recovery shards
* then in the end the last 60 bytes of zeros get clipped.  I did not bother to clip these out to make it obvious what the conceptual model error is 

### davxy `erasure_coding` circa 3/6/25

davxy Recovery shards: from [src/davxy/test_segment_shards_tiny.json](src/davxy/test_segment_shards_tiny.json).

* 0: "0x6f6c..."
* 1: "0xfeaf..."
* 2: "0x9821..."
* 3: "0x09e2..."

Our Recovery shards:
* 0: "4e53..."
* 1: "df90..."
* 2: "0a8f..."
* 3: "9b4c..."

THEY DO NOT MATCH =(

```
root@jamduna:~/go/src/github.com/jam-duna/jamtestnet/erasurecoding# cargo test test_davxy  -- --nocapture
    Finished test [unoptimized + debuginfo] target(s) in 0.01s
     Running unittests src/lib.rs (target/debug/deps/erasure_coding-a68d8e42a63717ee)

running 1 test
davxy Original segment raw byte length: 4104 bytes
davxy JSON shard 0 length: 2052 bytes
davxy JSON shard 1 length: 2052 bytes
davxy JSON shard 2 length: 2052 bytes
davxy JSON shard 3 length: 2052 bytes
davxy JSON shard 4 length: 2052 bytes
davxy JSON shard 5 length: 2052 bytes
davxy Original shard 0:  (2112 bytes)
davxy Original shard 1:  (2112 bytes)
davxy Recovery shard 0:  (2112 bytes)
davxy Recovery shard 1:  (2112 bytes)
davxy Recovery shard 2:  (2112 bytes)
davxy Recovery shard 3:  (2112 bytes)
test tests::test_davxy ... ok

test result: ok. 1 passed; 0 failed; 0 ignored; 0 measured; 1 filtered out; finished in 0.13s
```

### javajam `erasure_coding` circa 3/6/25

Javajam shards From javajam segment_tiny.json:

* 0: "8dd1..."
* 1: "889d..."
* 2: "48db..."
* 3: "4d97..."

Our recovery shards:
* 0: "73d8..."
* 1: "76a8..."
* 2: "d080..."
* 3: "d5f0..."

```
root@jamduna:~/go/src/github.com/jam-duna/jamtestnet/erasurecoding# cargo test test_javajam  -- --nocapture
    Finished test [unoptimized + debuginfo] target(s) in 0.01s
     Running unittests src/lib.rs (target/debug/deps/erasure_coding-a68d8e42a63717ee)

running 1 test

JJ JSON shard 1 length: 2052 bytes
JJ JSON shard 2 length: 2052 bytes
JJ JSON shard 3 length: 2052 bytes
JJ JSON shard 4 length: 2052 bytes
JJ JSON shard 5 length: 2052 bytes
JJ Recovery shard 0:  (2112 bytes)
JJ Recovery shard 1:  (2112 bytes)
JJ Recovery shard 2:  (2112 bytes)
JJ Recovery shard 3:  (2112 bytes)
test tests::test_javajam ... ok

test result: ok. 1 passed; 0 failed; 0 ignored; 0 measured; 1 filtered out; finished in 0.13s
```
